permeate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if liquid, gas etc permeates something, it enters it and spreads through every part of it
permeate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The smell of diesel oil permeated the air.
Rain permeates through the ground to add to ground water levels.
permeate.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if ideas, beliefs, emotions etc permeate something, they are present in every part of it
permeate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Racism continues to permeate our society.
An emotional intensity permeates every one of O'Connorâ€™s songs.
